keyword: how many calories in a ear of corn
title: How Many Calories in an Ear of Corn?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a ear of corn, including carbs, protein, fiber, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with easy tweaks.
h1: How Many Calories in an Ear of Corn?
assumptions: Medium ear of yellow sweet corn (~90 g edible kernels), boiled or steamed on the cob, no added butter, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by corn variety, size, freshness, cooking method, and additions like butter; check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium ear of corn provides about 90 kcal and 19 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Remove corn silk and add salt (minimal change)

faqs.q: How many calories in a ear of corn without butter?
faqs.a: About 90 kcal for one medium plain ear.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an ear of corn?
faqs.a: Roughly 19 g total carbs, including 2.7 g fiber and 6 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is corn on the cob high in protein?
faqs.a: No, one ear has about 3.3 g protein; it's more carb-focused.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in corn?
faqs.a: Boiled or steamed is low-cal; grilling adds minimal, but butter or oil increases significantly.

faqs.q: How much fiber in a ear of corn?
faqs.a: Around 2.7 g per medium ear, aiding digestion.
